requirements.title: A standard MUST have an ID
A standard MUST have a Title
A standard MUST have a Description
A standard MUST have one or more Requirements
A standard MUST have Tags
A standard MUST show when it was Last Updated
A principle MUST have a title
A principle MUST have a description
A principle MUST have a rationale
A principle MUST state expected applications and implications
A principle MUST have tags
A principle MUST show when it was last updated

standards.title: Minimal documentation set for a product

requirements.title: Product documentation MUST include a description of the product and what it is for
Product documentation MUST include key architectural views
requirements.comment:
Some details in decision log, but needs more info
https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/609

requirements.title: Product documentation MUST include a decision log
Product documentation MUST include runbooks for expected tasks
requirements.comment:
- Deployment is automated.
- See CONTRIBUTING.md https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md for deployment
- See https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/tree/main/technical-docs/accessibility for accessibility checks
- See https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/blob/main/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md for pull request guidance

requirements.title: Product documentation MUST include information about observability
requirements.comment:
https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/73
https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/74

requirements.title: Product documentation MUST include build, release and deployment processes
requirements.comment: See https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md

requirements.title: Open source repositories MUST contain a licence file
Open source repositories MUST have a licence that adheres to the Open Source Definition
Open source repositories MUST state who owns the copyright
Infrastructure definitions MUST be stored as code
requirements.comment: Infrastructure is managed by core-cloud, who do use infrastructure as code

requirements.title: Infrastructure definitions MUST be validated
requirements.comment: Infrastructure is managed by core-cloud

requirements.title: Secrets MUST NOT be stored in infrastructure definitions
requirements.comment: Secrets stored in GitHub secrets and variables

requirements.title: Source management best practices MUST be followed for infrastructure definitions
requirements.comment: Infrastructure is managed by core-cloud

requirements.title: Secrets MUST be generated in accordance with the Home Office Password Policy
requirements.comment: Deployment is via assuming a role based on AWS / GitHub trust relationship

requirements.title: You MUST only store secrets in an approved secret management system
You MUST proactively manage access to secrets
You MUST implement secret scanning
requirements.comment: Secrets are scanned for with GitHub Advanced Security setup in the repo.

requirements.title: You MUST ensure that secrets are not exported into monitoring systems
You MUST document how secrets are managed
requirements.comment: Mentioned in technical decision log, could be more explicitly documented

requirements.title: You MUST monitor the usage of secrets to identify suspicious behaviour
requirements.comment: Managed by core-cloud

requirements.title: You MUST have a response plan ready to enact if you have an incident
requirements.comment: See SECURITY.md

standards.title: Managing the security of software dependencies

requirements.title: You MUST assess the security of external components before introducing them into software designs
You MUST maintain a discoverable dependency tree for your systems
You MUST proactively identify vulnerabilities in dependencies with scanning and other tools
You MUST regularly update, replace and remove dependencies
Products MUST be developed to meet the Home Office Accessibility Standard
All code commits MUST be cryptographically signed by the author of that commit
All Source code repositories MUST require all commits be signed

standards.title: Encrypting data at rest and in transit

requirements.title: Data at rest MUST be encrypted
requirements.comment: No data stored at rest

requirements.title: Data in transit MUST be encrypted
requirements.comment: Only data transferred is page content, done over HTTPS

requirements.title: Cryptographic keys MUST be protected
requirements.comment: Managed by core-cloud/AWS who manage these securely

requirements.title: Infrastructure MUST be observable relative to defined service level expectations
requirements.comment: This is managed by core-cloud, but we should have visibility / alerting

requirements.title: CPU utilisation MUST be observable
requirements.comment: Static site served from S3 via CloudFront - monitoring and managing CPU is AWS's responsibility.

requirements.title: Memory utilisation MUST be observable
requirements.comment: Static site served from S3 via CloudFront - monitoring and managing memory is AWS's responsibility.

requirements.title: Disk utilisation MUST be observable
requirements.comment: Static site served from S3 via CloudFront - monitoring and managing disk space is AWS's responsibility.

requirements.title: Network utilisation MUST be observable
requirements.comment: Static site served from S3 via CloudFront - monitoring and managing network is AWS's responsibility.

requirements.title: Historical infrastructure monitoring metrics MUST be retained for analysis
requirements.comment: This is managed by core-cloud, but we should have visibility / alerting

requirements.title: Naming conventions MUST be consistent
requirements.comment: Not a low code implementation

requirements.title: Acronyms or uncommon abbreviations MUST be defined in a central or project glossary
requirements.comment: Not a low code implementation

requirements.title: Workflow, action step and scope block names MUST be descriptive and convey the purpose or objective
requirements.comment: Not a low code implementation

requirements.title: Workflow, action step and scope block names MUST begin with a verb to describe the function, followed by the subject of the verb
requirements.comment: Not a low code implementation

requirements.title: Words in a workflow name MUST be separated by a space where possible
requirements.comment: Not a low code implementation

requirements.title: Scope blocks that are used for error handling MUST be prefixed with the word ‘Try’ or ‘Catch’
requirements.comment: Not a low code implementation

requirements.title: You MUST test early and often
You MUST automate tests
You MUST make tests repeatable
You MUST have a way of measuring the effectiveness of testing
requirements.comment: https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/615

requirements.title: Tests MUST have a purpose and explicit result
You MUST think about the edge cases
Service reliability MUST be observable relative to defined service level expectations
requirements.comment: Managed by core-cloud https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/614

requirements.title: Service MUST be tolerant to expected and unexpected failure of a data centre
requirements.comment: S3 and CloudFront have this tolerance built in

requirements.title: Service MUST be tolerant to expected and unexpected failure of physical or virtualised hardware as well as network
requirements.comment: S3 and CloudFront have this tolerance built in

requirements.title: Service MUST be tolerant to expected and unexpected failure of upstream services such as databases
requirements.comment: S3 and CloudFront have this tolerance built in

requirements.title: Service MUST be sized appropriately for normal operations and MUST be able to automatically scale as appropriate based on metrics
requirements.comment: Managed by AWS

requirements.title: Service MUST be able to handle requests to protect the overall service
requirements.comment: S3 and CloudFront have this built in

requirements.title: Service MUST be able to tolerate expected load
requirements.comment: S3 and CloudFront have this tolerance built in

requirements.title: Service MUST be able to tolerate expected stress
requirements.comment: S3 and CloudFront have this tolerance built in

requirements.title: Service MUST be soak tested
requirements.comment: Managed and tested by AWS

requirements.title: You MUST include a form of versioning to your API
requirements.comment: Version can be included in url when there is a breaking change to the current API

requirements.title: You MUST return appropriate status codes from each endpoint
You MUST use appropriate nouns for resource names
You MUST include some way to observe your API
requirements.comment: https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/614

requirements.title: You MUST apply security best practices
requirements.comment: Only API is public data. Site is served over HTTPS.

requirements.title: You MUST validate inputs
requirements.comment: API is read only

requirements.title: You MUST consider authentication and authorisation
requirements.comment: API is public data

requirements.title: You MUST test your API
requirements.comment: JSON schema definition verified by cypress tests

requirements.title: You MUST consider scalability of your API
requirements.comment: Scaling managed by AWS S3/CloudFront

requirements.title: You MUST use an API Specification
You MUST include your API on the relevant registers if your API is public
You MUST have documentation on requests and responses of all endpoints
You MUST provide specific feedback in error responses
requirements.comment: Static json file generated at build time

requirements.title: You MUST document how to connect to your API
requirements.comment: https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/620

requirements.title: You MUST document how to raise an issue with your API if your API has external consumers
requirements.comment: Same issue reporting as rest of site https://engineering.homeoffice.gov.uk/provide-feedback/

requirements.title: You MUST document information on rate limits
requirements.comment: Managed by cloud-cloud, there are not use cases for needing a high number of requests to the API that would hit rate limits.

requirements.title: You MUST document different versions of your API
requirements.comment: https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/620

requirements.title: You MUST prioritise early testing
You MUST validate the integration of your components
You MUST automate where practical to do so
You MUST avoid large numbers of end-to-end tests
You MUST capture metrics to provide evidence of the efficiency of your tests
requirements.comment: https://github.com/UKHomeOffice/engineering-guidance-and-standards/issues/615
